byline.contributor: Marc Tracy, Michael Paulson and Quentin Hardy contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and ERIK ECKHOLM

abstract: Passage of Indiana law that may make it easier for businesses to refuse service to gay couples ignites uproar of protest from technology companies, actors and NCAA, which is based in Indianapolis and will hold Final Four of men's basketball tournament there; supporters of measure say it protects religious freedoms.
lead_paragraph: A measure described as protecting religious freedom was assailed by political and business leaders because it could allow businesses to refuse service to gay couples.

headline.main: Indiana Law Denounced as Invitation to Discriminate Against Gays
headline.print_headline: Right to Deny Service to Gays Stirs Broad Uproar
